Operations Support Staff Job at Bigkoko Global Services Limited




        
    

        
        Bigkoko Global Services Limited is the Nigerian arm of Bigkoko Group, a multinational enterprise focused on transforming access to mobility, retail, IoTs and digital finance across Africa. Operating from its HQ in Enugu Nigeria, the company is strategically positioned to serve one of Africa’s fastest-growing consumer markets through a three-pronged model that integrates e-mobility, value retail, and digital gifting solutions.

Bigkoko Naija is built to power mobility, smart shopping, and cashless gifting across Nigeria. The company operates through three innovative service divisions.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Operations Support Staff
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers

Position Overview


	The selected candidate will support the Operations Manager in executing Bigkoko’s business blueprints for the Nigerian market, focusing on customer acquisition and engagement, field coordination, and partner on-boarding during the product launch phase.


Key Responsibilities


	Assist in the coordination and execution of the Bigkoko Gift Card and e-Ride launch activities in Port Harcourt.
	Serve as a liaison between vendors, riders, and customers for smooth daily operations.
	Handle cashless transaction reconciliations, vendor on-boarding, and basic administrative duties including customer support.
	Maintain excellent customer service standards and ensure brand consistency across partner locations.
	Support field marketing campaigns and collect real-time feedback from users and merchants.
	Prepare daily/weekly reports for the Operations Manager.


Qualifications & Experience


	Candidates should possess an OND (Ordinary National Diploma) in Administration, Social Sciences, Marketing, Management or related fields.
	Proven experience as a cashier, receptionist, marketer, and customer service representative.
	Strong interpersonal and communication skills.
	Ability to multitask, work independently, and adapt to fast-paced environments.
	Basic computer literacy (MS Office, Google Workspace, mobile apps, virtual meetings/presentation).
	Familiarity with digital payments or mobility services is an added advantage.
	Candidates residing near Aba Road / Artillery Junction/Obigbo/Igbo-Etche Environs will be given preference.)


What We Offer


	Competitive compensation package plus three weeks paid leave per year.
	Growth opportunities in a Pan-African tech company.
	On-the-job training with exposure to Bigkoko’s digital business ecosystem.
	Opportunity to be part of a pioneering team shaping cashless convenience in Nigeria.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a short Cover Letter (max 1 page) to: careers@bigkokogroup.com using “Application – Operations Support Staff (Port Harcourt)” as the subject of the email

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Control Manager",
  "description": "Dangote Group is one of Nigeria&rsquo;s most diversified business conglomerates with a hard &ndash; earned reputation for excellent business practices and products&rsquo; quality with its operational headquarters in the bustling metropolis of Lagos, Nigeria in West Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Control Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Ibese, Ogun

Summary


	The Control Manager is responsible for overseeing all fleet, journey, and driver performance activities within the control tower to ensure operational efficiency, productivity, and compliance with safety and regulatory standards.
	The role ensures the accuracy, integrity, and timeliness of all driver and vehicle data, supporting effective decision-making and continuous improvement across the organization.


Key Responsibilities


	Monitor real-time fleet and driver activities using telematics, GPS, and tracking systems.
	Ensure adherence to approved routes, rest hours, speed limits, and company journey policies.
	Conduct periodic audits of driver logs, trip records, and vehicle utilization.
	Track fleet performance metrics such as turnaround time, idle time, route adherence, and fuel efficiency.
	Identify unsafe driving patterns, non-compliance issues, or data anomalies and take corrective actions.
	Coordinate with fleet supervisors, drivers, and logistics teams to resolve operational issues promptly.
	Develop and track performance indicators related to driver productivity and fleet utilization.
	Generate accurate and timely productivity and compliance reports for management review.
	Analyze operational data to identify inefficiencies and recommend improvements.
	Support capacity-building and driver development programs to enhance performance and safety.
	Ensure full compliance with company policies, road transport regulations, and safety standards.
	Manage data accuracy and integrity across all reporting and monitoring platforms.
	Collaborate with IT and analytics teams to enhance tracking tools and automate reporting systems.
	Support incident investigations with accurate historical data and journey records.
	Provide insights and recommendations to management for operational and safety improvements.
	Stay updated on industry regulations, compliance frameworks, and emerging best practices.
	Lead continuous improvement initiatives to enhance efficiency, compliance, and driver performance.
	Ensure timely escalation and closure of all identified control and compliance gaps.
	Promote a culture of accountability, safety, and performance excellence within the control tower team.


Qualifications &amp; Experience

Control Manager Job at Dangote Group




        
    

        
        Dangote Group is one of Nigeria’s most diversified business conglomerates with a hard – earned reputation for excellent business practices and products’ quality with its operational headquarters in the bustling metropolis of Lagos, Nigeria in West Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Control Manager

Job Location: Ibese, Ogun

Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Control Manager is responsible for overseeing all fleet, journey, and driver performance activities within the control tower to ensure operational efficiency, productivity, and compliance with safety and regulatory standards.
	The role ensures the accuracy, integrity, and timeliness of all driver and vehicle data, supporting effective decision-making and continuous improvement across the organization.


Key Responsibilities


	Monitor real-time fleet and driver activities using telematics, GPS, and tracking systems.
	Ensure adherence to approved routes, rest hours, speed limits, and company journey policies.
	Conduct periodic audits of driver logs, trip records, and vehicle utilization.
	Track fleet performance metrics such as turnaround time, idle time, route adherence, and fuel efficiency.
	Identify unsafe driving patterns, non-compliance issues, or data anomalies and take corrective actions.
	Coordinate with fleet supervisors, drivers, and logistics teams to resolve operational issues promptly.
	Develop and track performance indicators related to driver productivity and fleet utilization.
	Generate accurate and timely productivity and compliance reports for management review.
	Analyze operational data to identify inefficiencies and recommend improvements.
	Support capacity-building and driver development programs to enhance performance and safety.
	Ensure full compliance with company policies, road transport regulations, and safety standards.
	Manage data accuracy and integrity across all reporting and monitoring platforms.
	Collaborate with IT and analytics teams to enhance tracking tools and automate reporting systems.
	Support incident investigations with accurate historical data and journey records.
	Provide insights and recommendations to management for operational and safety improvements.
	Stay updated on industry regulations, compliance frameworks, and emerging best practices.
	Lead continuous improvement initiatives to enhance efficiency, compliance, and driver performance.
	Ensure timely escalation and closure of all identified control and compliance gaps.
	Promote a culture of accountability, safety, and performance excellence within the control tower team.


Qualifications & Experience


	Bachelor’s degree in Transport Management, Logistics, Safety Management, or a related field.
	Minimum of 10 years of experience in fleet monitoring, journey management, or transport compliance roles, including at least 2 years in a supervisory or managerial capacity.
	Familiarity with Safety Management Systems (SMS) and performance monitoring tools is an added advantage.


Skills & Competencies:


	Strong knowledge of journey management, fleet operations, and transport compliance standards.
	Proficiency in telematics, GPS tracking, Power BI, or other dashboard and reporting systems.
	Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills.
	High attention to data accuracy and integrity.
	Strong communication and leadership abilities.
	Ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.


Benefits


	Training and Development
	Pension Plan
	Paid Time Off
	Private Health Insurance.

Project & Space Management:


	Lead planning and execution of facility projects, including expansion, relocations, and refurbishments. 
	Ensure optimal utilization of space to support operational efficiency and Customer comfort.

Health, Safety, and Environmental (HSE) Compliance:
